name: Roasted Golden Beets with Orange Pepper Vinaigrette
author: Culinary Envy
summary: Roasted golden beets are baked in the oven and paired with an orange pepper vinaigrette - beet rounds of yummy goodness.
ingredients: 1 pound golden beets, top and bottom trimmed and greens removed
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Place golden beets in a shallow baking dish
Stir water and 2 tablespoons olive oil together in a small bowl and pour over beets, tossing them in the liquid to coat completely
Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil
Bake in the preheated oven until beets are tender when pierced with a skewer, 45 to 55 minutes
Remove form oven, uncover, and let cool for 10 minutes
Slip skins off beets and cut them crosswise into thin 1/4-inch slices
Whisk 3 tablespoons olive oil and balsamic vinegar together in a small bowl
Add orange juice, honey, orange zest, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper and whisk until vinaigrette is well combined
Spread beets onto a plate and drizzle with vinaigrette
Toss gently with sliced red onion and season with parsley
